intro: Dipteracanthus porrigens var. triflorus, commonly known as the three-flowered dipteracanthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
